page.title: 07THE VILLAGE OF CURRIDGE
page.content: Curridge is a small village. There are less than 200 houses. We sometimes wish that it was bigger so that we could have more of our friends close by. The village is too small for social amenities like a cinema or a swimming pool and we have to go by car to a town for these. We would like to have a park or an adventure playground where we can meet or play. The village is always clean and tidy and looks beautiful. Several of the houses are old (300 years is the oldest) and some of the trees are old. It is quiet and peaceful and sometimes you can see wild animals - deer, rabbits, foxes and sometimes squirrels dash across the road between the trees. We can ride our bikes on the roads which are not very busy, and on the footpaths through the woods.
